news.title: Karnataka HC pushes for GIS mapping of land parcels in state
news.para: Karnataka High Court has instructed the state government to create a unified land data platform. This platform will use GIS technology and high-resolution satellite imagery. It will digitally map all land parcels and forest boundaries. Each land parcel will get a unique ID. The system will streamline land-related applications. A high-level cell will resolve conflicting records.

news.title: Tenant verification drives double in first half of 2025
news.para: Goa police significantly increased tenant verification drives in the first half of 2025, conducting 471 drives compared to 236 in all of 2024. These drives, part of the 'Know Your Neighbour' initiative, aim to prevent crime and enhance public safety by verifying tenant, servant, and foreigner information. The process involves cross-verification with native police stations to identify potential risks.

news.title: Subodh Runwal-promoted Runwal Enterprises gets Sebi nod for ₹1,000 crore IPO
news.para: Runwal Enterprises, a Mumbai-based real estate developer, has received SEBI approval for a ₹1,000 crore IPO. The IPO proceeds will fuel expansion and strengthen the balance sheet. Between 2019 and 2024, Runwal Enterprises ranked second in Mumbai for new residential launches and sales. The company reported revenues of ₹662.19 crore in FY24, a significant jump from the previous year.

news.title: Mumbai: Housing society can’t charge excess fee from rented flats
news.para: The Chaitanya Cooperative Housing Society in Mumbai has been directed by a deputy registrar to cease collecting excess charges, specifically a 'building development fund,' from members renting out their flats, beyond the permissible non-occupancy charges. This order came after a flat owner, A Shaikh, complained about the society's illegal levy of Rs 5,000 annually, which violates cooperative society bye-laws.

news.title: Hyderabad development body to auction 93 plots from September 17
news.para: After a two-year hiatus, the Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority (HMDA) is set to auction 93 open plots across Hyderabad on September 17-19. The e-auction includes plots in Bachupally, Turkayamjal, and Kokapet, with upset prices ranging from ₹35,000 to ₹1.75 lakh per square yard. Proceeds from the auction will fund key infrastructure projects, including elevated corridors and a greenfield radial road.

news.title: All Lavasa suitors raise offers in third round; Valor Estates leads
news.para: The competition for Lavasa Corp intensifies as Valor Estates, Welspun-Ashdan combine, and Yogayatan Group raise their bids. Valor Estates leads with ₹946 crore. Welspun consortium scores higher based on the evaluation matrix. Yogayatan Group had previously opposed revised bids. The creditor's decision to extend the resolution timeline led to this third round. Any legal challenges could further delay the process.

news.title: Noida: Guards, housekeepers go on strike over salary dues, lock Ecovillage-1 gate for hours
news.para: In Greater Noida West's Supertech Ecovillage-1, around 250 housekeeping and security staff initiated a strike due to unpaid wages for two months by the outgoing maintenance agency, Gravity. This action disrupted sanitation and security, blocking society gates and causing inconvenience to over 20,000 residents.

news.title: Gujarat RERA seeks govt help to finish stalled World Trade Centre project at GIFT City
news.para: GujRERA has urged the Urban Development Department to find a solution for the stalled World Trade Centre project at GIFT City, where investor funds are stuck. This intervention follows the ED's arrest of the promoter for real estate fraud and the allottees' inability to complete the project.

news.title: H-RERA orders compensation to OSB Expressway Towers' buyers with 11% interest
news.para: Hundreds of homebuyers of OSB Expressway Towers project in Sector 109 are awaiting possession even after eight years. Haryana Real Estate Regulatory Authority (HRera) directed Ocean Seven Buildtech Pvt Ltd to compensate buyers with 11% interest for the delay. HRera also barred the developer from imposing extra charges beyond the builder-buyer agreement, offering partial relief to the affected homebuyers.

news.title: Charges against Esencia RWA in Gurugram trigger probe into illegal deals and financial irregularities
news.para: Following resident complaints of governance failures and financial irregularities, the district registrar has launched an inquiry into the Esencia RWA in Sector 67. Allegations include unauthorized agreements with neighboring societies and mismanagement of funds. The inquiry officer will investigate and submit a report within 45 days, while the RWA refutes the claims as politically motivated.

news.title: Opening Aravalis to urbanisation? Haryana defines 'forest' for environmental law implementation
news.para: Haryana has defined 'forest' for environmental law implementation, requiring at least 5 hectares with 40% canopy density, or 2 hectares adjoining notified forests. This excludes smaller patches, low-density Aravali vegetation, and plantations.

news.title: Godrej Properties acquires 7.8 acre land in Hyderabad for ₹547.75 crore
news.para: Godrej Properties secured a 7.825-acre land parcel in Kukatpally, Hyderabad, through an e-auction conducted by the Telangana Housing Board. GPL's winning bid for the residential group housing land was ₹547.75 crore.

news.title: Bihar CM inspects construction work of Patna metro rail project
news.para: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar inspected the ongoing construction of the Patna Metro Rail Project, urging officials to expedite the work. He reviewed the Bariyarpur Metro Terminal, including coaches, tracks, and infrastructure, which will serve as a maintenance and operational hub. Kumar also assessed the progress at the Zero Mile Metro Station, emphasizing efficient project execution.

news.title: IKEA expects India business to grow 10% in FY25, to expand network
news.para: IKEA anticipates a sales surge of over 10% in India for FY25, driven by strategic expansion plans. The company aims to penetrate the Indian market through a mix of large format stores and smaller, more accessible city stores.

news.title: Do not raze unauthorised houses during Ganesh festival: Maharashtra minister orders authorities
news.para: Maharashtra Revenue Minister Chandrashekhar Bawankule has instructed officials to halt demolitions of unauthorized houses and refrain from issuing notices during the Ganesh festival, responding to appeals from North Mumbai citizens.

news.title: Window Magic to offer fenestration solutions for Sarojini Nagar redevelopment project
news.para: Window Magic has been selected as the key fenestration partner for the Sarojini Nagar redevelopment project in New Delhi. The project, led by Varindera Construction and Girdhari Lal Construction, involves the construction of approximately 86 GPRA towers.

news.title: Lowe's to buy Foundation Building Materials for $8.8 billion
news.para: Lowe's is set to acquire Foundation Building Materials for nearly $8.8 billion, boosting its presence in the professional builder market amid slowing DIY sales. The company also raised its annual sales forecast after exceeding second-quarter profit estimates. This acquisition follows Home Depot's move to acquire GMS, signaling increased competition in the pro-focused distribution sector.

news.title: Geberit's profit down 2.3% at $293.23 million in Q2 2025
news.para: Geberit's second-quarter earnings fell short of expectations due to a decline in new construction across Europe. The company anticipates this downward trend to persist in the second half, impacting overall performance. Despite headwinds in the European construction industry, Geberit remains optimistic about its renovation business and expects strong demand in India and the Gulf region.

news.title: Ultratech Cement to sell 6.49% stake in India Cements
news.para: Ultratech Cement's board has approved the sale of 2,01,12,330 equity shares of The India Cements, representing 6.49% of its equity share capital, through an offer for sale.

news.title: Welspun One acquires 107 acres land in Karnataka
news.para: Welspun One Logistics Parks (WOLP) has expanded its land bank in Karnataka and Tamil Nadu to over 260 acres with recent acquisitions in Hoskote and Devanahalli. The company plans to invest $250 million to develop six million sq ft of warehousing space.
